item.description: More researchers are adopting prereigstration, but are current tools serving them well?

item.description: Visual analytics tools should no longer be a garden to harvest interesting but probably unreliable patterns.

item.title: ğŸ­ Does Risk Theatre work?
item.description: Risk theatre is a variant of icon arrays, where we color the seat map of a theatre according to some proportion we want to communicate.

item.title: ğŸ” Climate model ensemble similarity comparisons
item.description: SIParCS internship at the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR). Worked with Dr. Rick Brownrigg.

item.title: ğŸ™‡ Physiological computing
item.description: I worked with Professor Evan Peck at Bucknell on a project about using physiological signals to improve decision-making.

item.title: âš—ï¸ Mussels and hydraulic fracturing
item.description: As a freshman, I dabbled in geochemistry with Professor Carl Kirby in Geology & Environmental Geosciences at Bucknell University.

The poster I made for Dr. Audrey Michal’s talk. I am a student coordinator for this visualization workshop series at Michigan. Researchers across campus (20+ departments!) show up to our events and learn to make better visualizations. It’s a great reminder of why we study those pretty pictures. The map I prepared for a geomorphology mapping project in central Pennsylvania. Solving a geomorph puzzle requires a little bit of hiking, photography, and guesswork.
